ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish

comments: Harvey Weiss is the best thing about this course. He's passionate, he's quirky, he's charismatic. He brings a particular archaeological lens to the study of global climate change and presents information in an unforgettable way. I really appreciated the pedagogical approach of focusing on a few important ideas and investigating them from many perspectives. So many professors sacrifice quantity for quality but Professor Weiss took a path I wish more would take: quality over quantity.My focus is on urban environmental issues. I took this class purely out of intellectual curiosity but it's really deepened my thinking on the issues on which I focus. Who knew that the human settlements and acute climate change events of ancient Mesopotamia could be so relevant to my thinking about the present day?!?!
I think that the discussion sessions with the tf's were very helpful.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The syllabus, oy vey, the syllabus.The syllabus cannot be a dynamic document because we have no idea when he's update it and it's impossible to download most of the time.One syllabus. At the beginning of the semester. Period.If he needs a dynamic document, open up a google doc.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Professor Weiss and both the TAs made it clear that they were available and made true on their promises.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: My focus is on urban environmental issues. I took this class purely out of intellectual curiosity but it's really deepened my thinking on the issues on which I focus.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The instructor recommended it to me to supplement my studies. It counts as a science credit for me.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: It did, but in unexpected ways. It's not a cut and dry class. Professor Weiss is very creative in his presentation of material.He presents the science, for sure, but his take on that science is pretty unusual.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: I'm not sure what I expected but I got a lot out of the class. I probably wasn't expecting a class so focused on climate change. Even though climate change is not my thing, I loved what I learned.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you go in expecting to have a linear progression from ancient Mesopotamia to the present day, you will be disappointed. If you go in willing to learn from an unusual professor and are comfortable with loose ends, you won't be disappointed.
